benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/bundles - Retrieve bundles for account

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC08, TC20) validate successful retrievals with combinations of query parameters and default behavior.
Empty Response: TC07 explicitly covers accounts with no bundles returning an empty JSON array.

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage for externalKey, bundlesFilter, audit (FULL, MINIMAL), combined query params, unsupported/extra params, edge cases and malformed inputs (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC11, TC12, TC23, TC24).
Error Handling: Invalid accountId format (TC09) and non-existent account (TC10) map to 400 and 404 respectively as per the story. Unsupported audit value is covered (TC11).
Authorization: Unauthorized access is covered (TC13) returning 401.
Service & Dependency Failures: Service unavailable (TC14), dependency unavailable (TC21 -> 502), and timeout (TC17 -> 504) are included.
Security: Malicious input (injection/XSS) is explicitly tested (TC15).
Scalability/Reliability: Large data volume (TC16) and concurrent requests (TC18) are present.
Regression & Integration: Regression test (TC19), data consistency after creation (TC22), and backward compatibility (TC20) are included.
Documentation/Schema Compliance: TC25 covers API documentation and response structure compliance.
gaps: Pagination: No test covers pagination behavior (page/offset/limit) or server-side paging headers for very large result sets — important given TC16 (large data) exists but pagination is not tested.
Caching Behavior / HTTP Headers: No tests verify caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match / 304 responses).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests simulate high-frequency calls to validate rate limiting responses (e.g., 429) or throttling behavior.
Authorization Scope / Forbidden (403): Tests cover missing auth (401) but do not cover insufficient permissions (403) or role-based access controls if applicable.

Schema & Field-Level Validation: While TC01 and TC25 assert Bundle objects and field presence, there are no explicit tests for field types/constraints, required vs optional fields, or malformed Bundle responses from downstream services.
Response Error Body Consistency: Error body format and fields (error codes/messages structure) are not validated across error scenarios (400/404/502/503/504).
Performance SLAs: TC16 checks response time informally, but there are no controlled performance tests with thresholds, load profiles, or profiling to ensure consistent <2s under load.
Pagination + Filters Interaction: Interaction between pagination and filters (e.g., externalKey + paging) is not covered.
Rate-limit / Caching interaction: No tests for how caching behaves under repeated requests or with varying auth tokens.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: include scenarios for page/limit/offset, verify total counts, paging headers (Link, X-Total-Count) and behavior when paginating filtered results.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control headers, conditional requests (If-None-Match) and 304 Not Modified responses.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts to validate 429 responses and backoff behavior; include tests for client behavior on 429.
Add 403/permission tests: cover cases where an authenticated user lacks permission to access bundles, ensuring 403 responses and proper error messages.

Add schema/field validation tests: explicitly validate types, required fields, nullable fields, and boundary values for Bundle properties; include negative tests for malformed Bundle responses from downstream services.
Standardize and validate error response bodies: create tests that assert consistent error payload structure (code, message, details) across 400/401/403/404/429/502/503/504 scenarios.
Strengthen performance tests: convert TC16 into controlled load/perf tests with clear SLA assertions and run under realistic load to prove the <2s requirement.
Cover pagination + filter interactions: ensure filters (externalKey, bundlesFilter) work correctly when results are paged.
Add caching + auth interplay tests: verify different tokens and scopes do not accidentally return cached data from another user.
Add rate-limit + concurrency interplay tests: ensure high concurrency does not violate correctness and that throttling is applied gracefully.
